item.name: Blindfold of Tremorsense
entries: You can spend an action to pull this blindfold over your eyes. While the blindfold covers your eyes, you gain {@sense tremorsense} to a range of 10 feet, but you are completely blind beyond this radius. Removing the blindfold requires an action

item.name: Aria's Arrow
entries: This arrow is made of solid metal, with sharp, barbed spines along the arrowhead.

Aria's Arrow sings through the air at rapid speed when fired, dealing damage as normal on a hit. The arrowhead expands and embeds itself into whichever creature it strikes, and remains stuck in the creature's flesh until it is removed or the creature is slain. The arrow cannot embed itself in a creature that does not have organic flesh, such as most constructs, elementals, and oozes. While the arrow is embedded in a creature, the creature must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw at the end of each of it's turns. On a failed save, the target gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

As an action, the target or a creature adjacent it can attempt to remove the arrow with a DC 15 Strength check. The target takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage when the arrow is removed. When the arrow is removed, any levels of {@condition exhaustion} applied by the arrow disappear.
Whenever the arrow is removed from a creature or its corpse, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the arrow snaps and crumbles to dust, forever destroyed.

item.name: Armor of Power
entries: While attuned to this armor, you gain the following benefits when you wear it:

items: You gain resistance to fire and poison damage.
You sink in water or similar liquids.
You can endure natural environments with temperatures of -43 to 140 degrees Celsius without needing to make Constitution checks.
You can amplify your voice to be audible out to a range of 300 feet.

entries: The armor is vacuumed sealed, allowing you to survive in a vacuum or pressurized environment.
The armor moves under its own power. Its weight doesn't count against your carrying capacity.
If you are reduced to 0 hit points while wearing this armor, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the armor's power source ruptures as per a retributive strike.

entries.name: Retributive Strike
entries: While wearing the armor, you can use an action to overload it, performing a retributive strike. The armor is destroyed and releases its remaining magic in an explosion that expands to fill a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on it.
You have a {@chance 50|50 percent} chance to instantly travel to a random plane of existence, avoiding the explosion.

If you fail to avoid the effect, you take damage equal your maximum hit points. Every other creature in the area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes force damage equal to your maximum hit points, or half as much on a successful saving throw.

item.name: Adjatha the Drinker
entries: This blade belonged to Dabbar, a long dead servant of Bhaal that exercised control over his minions in the most brutal of ways. In addition to strengthening the mind against the guile of others, the sword absorbs life energy from an opponent with each successful hit, healing the user. Dabbar considered it a failure of his officers if he returned from battle in less than perfect health, and as the rest of the company watched, he would administer beatings until fully healed.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a living target you get 1 temporary hit point, also while you are attuned to the Adjatha the Drinker, you can't be {@condition charmed}.

item.name: Albruin
entries: Basalin was a large man, rumored, far from his hearing, to be a werebear. He long wielded the sword Albruin in the protection of his village, slaying giant spiders that plagued the area. The sword protected him from their poison and also allowed him to see {@condition invisible} Red Wizards who controlled some of the more fantastic variants. The reason for their enmity is unknown.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

While you are attuned to the Albruin you are immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition and have immunity to poison damage. You can use an action to cast {@spell see invisibility} on self. The Albruin can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

item.name: Amulet of Cheetah Speed
entries: This amulet grants its wearer fleetness of foot. Not surprisingly it is popular among fleeing felons, travelers and cowards.

You gain bonus 10 ft to your walking speed. Additionally, you can use action to invoke power of amulet to cast {@spell haste} on self. Amulet of Cheetah Speed can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

item.name: Amulet of Spell Warding
entries: A favorite item of protection for a mage entering a magical duel, this amulet provides protection against spells, but does not interfere with the mage's own spellcasting.
You have advantage on saving throws against spells while you wear this amulet.

item.name: Angurvadal
entries: Also known as the Stream of Anguish, this is the legendary burning blade of Frithiof.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit with an attack using this magic sword, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage.
Additionally, you can use action to invoke power of Angurvadal to raise your Strength up to 22 for 1 minute.
Angurvadal can't be used this way again until the next dawn

item.name: Shisui, Water Slasher
entries: Masters of movement and manipulators of momentum, the river ronin were protectors of the waterways.
Legend says such samurai could control water with their ki, forming it into shields, whips and whirlpools.
These blades, known as the shisui, gave the ronin the ability to conjure water to wield in even the driest deserts or most remote mountaintops.
This weapon has 5 charges and regains expended ld4 + 1 charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Aqua Conjuration
entries: As an action you can expend 1 charge to cast {@spell create or destroy water} spell but only to create water or you may expend 1 charge to cast {@spell control water} (save DC 17).

entries.name: Torrent
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can expend 1 charge to fire a torrent of water from your blade. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the attack action, this effect replaces one of them. You create a 2-foot-wide, 30-foot-long line of high pressure water. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or either be pushed 5 feet back or be knocked {@condition prone} (your choice).

entries.name: Jet
entries: As an action, you can expend 2 charges to propel yourself forward in a straight line up to 30 feet long to an unoccupied space you can see. Each creature in a 10-foot-wide line between your origin and your destination must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw as high powered jets of water slice into them. A creature takes {@damage 8d6} slashing damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a success.

item.name: Ruination
entries: When you attune to Ruination a scar of an arcane brand appears on your palm.
Once attuned you gain a bonus to attack and damage rolls equal to half your proficiency bonus rounded down (minimum 1).

With the weapon in your scared hand you can use a bonus action to cause the blade to glow red hot. The heated blade sheds dim light in a 10 ft radius and deals an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage to any target it hits. The blade remains hot until you use a bonus action to cool the blade or until you drop or sheathe the sword. ⁣ ⁣In addition, as part of an attack with the red hot blade you can cause it to become molten and elongate into a whip. ⁣ The weapon remains a whip until you mentally command it to revert to the red hot blade (no action required) or you drop it. ⁣ The fire from the whip sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you hit a large or smaller creature with the whip, you can dismiss any non fire damage inflicted and instead force the creature to make a contested {@skill Athletics} (Strength) or {@skill Acrobatics} (Dexterity) check. If you win the contest, you can either: knock it {@condition prone}, grapple it, pull it 5 feet towards you, or force it to drop an item it is holding. On subsequent turns a creature {@condition grappled} by the whip suffers {@damage 2d6} fire damage at the end of its turn.

entries.name: Branded
entries: You can cast {@spell Heat Metal} on Ruination as a reaction to a creature you can see within 60ft holding the weapon.

item.name: Stormsiren
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. On a hit it deals an additional I {@damage 1d8} Lightning damage.
The sword has 5 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Flash Step
entries: As an action, you can expend a charge of this weapon to instantly travel in a 30 ft line to an unoccupied space. You can choose to make an attack with this weapon against any creatures you move through while making this movement' Any creature hit takes an additional ld8 lightning damage.

entries.name: Thunder Step
entries: As an action, you can expend 2 charges to cast {@spell Thunder Step|XGE} at the 3th level When you cast the spell this way, the spell save DC is 17.

item.name: Bronze Bulwark
entries: The shield has 10 charges and regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Repelling Blast
entries: When you are hit by a melee attack while holding this shield you can use your reaction to spend 1 charge and release a blast of repulsive energy, forcing the attacker to make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker is pushed up to 30 feet directly away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Deflection
entries: You can also use this repelling property to attempt to deflect projectiles. When you're hit by a ranged weapon attack roll, you can use your reaction to spend 1 charge to force the attacker to reroll the attack roll and use the new roll's result.

entries.name: Surf's Up
entries: The shield is also capable of producing a gentle repelling field when placed on a liquid, allowing it to hover a few inches off the surface. While hovering in this way, you can stand on the shield and speak its command word to make it glide across the liquid. You control the movement and trajectory of the shield, which has a speed of 60 feet and can carry up to 400 pounds. If you take damage while riding the shield in this way, you must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check or fall {@condition prone} off of the shield.

item.name: Onikiri, Demon Cutter
entries: This magic weapon has 5 charges and regains expended ld4 + 1 charges daily at dawn. You can cast the {@spell light} cantrip on the blade at will.

entries.name: Radiant Wrath
entries: As a bonus action while holding the blade, you can expend 1 charge to imbue it with crackling radiant energy until the end of your next turn. While imbued, each time you hit a creature with an attack using this blade, it takes an additional {@damage 2d8} radiant damage. In addition each fiend within 10 feet of your target must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} radiant damage as crackling, radiant energy arcs out towards it.

entries.name: Demon Lure
entries: As a bonus action while holding the blade, you can expend 1 charge to draw the attention of one creature you can see within 30 feet of you, forcing it to make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. A creature with the fiend type makes this saving throw with disadvantage. On a failure, the creature becomes fixated on you. For the next minute the creature's speed is reduced to 0 and it is {@condition incapacitated}. This effect ends if you attack any other creature, if you cast a spell, if the target of this property is affected by a spell cast by a creature friendly to you, or creature or if a creature friendly to you damages the target of this effect.

entries.name: Blessed
entries: You can speak Celestial fluently and can expend a charge to cast {@spell protection from evil and good}, no concentration required, protecting the target from fiends only.

item.name: Ring of Great Success
entries: This ring was created by a wizard who valued planning and good tactics. If its wearer can secure advantageous conditions, the ring can help him achieve great success

While wearing this ring, whenever you roll attack roll or ability check with advantage and have the same roll on both of the dice, you can treat that {@dice d20} roll as a 20. Additionally, when an attack roll is made against you with disadvantage, and attacker has the same roll on both of the dice, you can treat that {@dice d20} roll as a 1.

item.name: Gloves of the Rime Keepers
entries: The warmest care comes from the coldest hands. This item has 5 charges and regains all charges at dawn. Whenever you take an instance of cold damage from a spell or ability, roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 6, this item regains a charge.

entries.name: Keep on Ice
entries: As an action, you can spend a charge to cast {@spell Spare the Dying} as icy frost stabilizes the target. You can spend 2 charges to cast {@spell Gentle Repose}, freezing a creature's body to keep it preserved for the duration.

entries.name: Coldhearted
entries: As an action you can spend 2 charges to harden the heart of a creature you touch with frosty protection. For the next minute the creature has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed} as the chill focuses their minds against invasion. This ability has no effect on undead or constructs.

entries.name: Frosty Embrace
entries: While attuned to this item, whenever you use a spell or ability to heal a creature, you can spend any number of charges to have the target gain a number of temporary hit points equal to five times the number of charges spent.

item.name: Mithril Armband
entries: You have a critical hit range of 19-20 while attuned and wearing this item.
This has 6 charges item and regains {@dice 1d4 + 2} expended charges daily at dawn.

items: You can use your bonus action to expend 1 charge to add +3 to your attack rolls this turn.
You can use your bonus action to expend 4 charges to make your critical hit range 18-20 for the next minute.

item.name: Razorpetal Longbow
entries: This bow is shaped from an enchanted flower. Embedded along its surface are hundreds of fragrant, razor-sharp petals.

As a bonus action while wielding the bow you can cause the petals to erupt into an airborne flurry that swirls around you for 1 minute. While the whirlwind of petals is active you have half cover and attacks with this bow deal an additional {@damage 1d4} slashing damage as petals fly alongside your arrows to slash at your targets. Additionally, if a creature touches you or hits you with a melee attack while this effect is active, it takes {@damage 1d4} slashing damage. The petals fall lifelessly to the ground at the end of the minute. The bow cannot be used again this way until the petals regrow at dawn.
Shandra left the imprint of a kiss in scarlet red lipstick and a shower of petals on the bodies of her victims, each horrifically lacerated by ten thousand tiny blades.

item.name: Pearl of Truth
entries: While holding this pearl, you can cast the spell zone of truth as an action once per day. The spell save DC is 12 and its duration is 10 minutes. This ability recharges at dawn each day

item.name: Potion of Blindsight
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain {@sense blindsight} in a 60-foot-radius for 1 hour.
The effect does not hinder your normal vision but allows you to "see" in absolute darkness while the potion lasts. The liquid inside the vial is viscous and inky in color

item.name: Mjolnir
entries: requires proficiency in {@skill Religion}

When the famous dwarven brother Brock and Sindri were challenged by Loki to prove their skill in smithing against the Sons of Ivaldi, they forged three great artifacts, the last and most powerful of which was the mighty warhammer Mjolnir, specifically designed for the god Thor.
The wielder of Mjolnir becomes the Champion of the god Thor and automatically gains proficiency in {@skill Athletics} and in the use of warhammers.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
It has the thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. Immediately after the ranged attack or at your command, the weapon flies back to your hand.
When you hit an enemy, whether melee or ranged, it deals {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 1d8} thunder damage.
Mjolnir has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it (Save DC 18):
Mjolnir regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, Mjolnir disappears forever.

item.name: Gungnir
entries: When the Sons of Ivaldi were challenged by Loki to prove their skill in smithing against the famous dwarven brother Brock and Sindri, they forged three great artifacts, one of which was the powerful golden spear Gungnir, specifically designed for the god Odin.
To receive this weapon, one must complete a Penance of Charity.
Gungnir is a one-time use weapon. Once used, it returns to the divine realm of Asgard.

When you activate this weapon (as a bonus action), its raw power destroys all armor and shielding devices you are wearing, absorbing its pieces to make itself stronger, leaving you with a base AC of 10 and giving you 2 points of {@condition exhaustion}.

The benefit of this sacrifice however, is that it transforms the spear into an unerring missile. As an action, you can hurl it at any target you can see (with no distance penalty). The spear ignores the target's AC, dealing {@damage 5d8} piercing damage{@damage  + 15d8} radiant damage.
There is no attack roll required for this weapon and no saving throw can defend from it.

item.name: Eye of Odin
entries: This artifact is the right eye of the God Odin, sacrificed when hanging upside-down from the world tree
Yggdrassil, in exchange for knowledge of the future. It is a white orb covered in blue arcane runes, with a single glowing blue circle in the place of an iris.
To attune to the Eye of Odin, you must gouge out your own right eye and place the artifact in the empty socket. If the eye is ever removed, you die.
You gain Truesight, and you can use an action to see through walls.
The Eye has 8 charges to cast one of the following spells (Save DC18):
The Eye regains {@dice 1d4 + 4} expended charges at dawn.
Each time you cast a spell from the Eye, there is a 5% chance that your soul will be claimed to join the halls of Valhalla.

item.name: Hand of Tyr
entries: This artifact is the right hand of the God of Justice-Tyr, bitten off just below the wrist by the monstrous wolf
Fenrir when he attempted to chain the creature.
To attune to the Hand of Tyr, you must chop off your right hand at the wrist and place the artefact against the stump. If the hand is ever removed, you die.
Your strength score becomes 20
Any melee spell attack or weapon attack from the hand deals an additional {@damage 2d8} Radiant damage
The Hand of Tyr has 8 charges to cast one of the following spells (Save DC18)
The Hand regains {@dice 1d4 + 4} expended charges at dawn.
Each time you cast a spell from the Hand, it casts {@spell Suggestion} on you to commit one act of selfless charity that day.

item.name: Sifjar
entries: Challenged by Loki to produce wondrous artifacts, the Sons of Ivaldi forged a golden headpiece to restore the Goddess Sif's shorn hair.
However, this is actually a Mimic that has been enchanted to obey the wearer and can transform itself to take the form and function of any armor or clothing.
The armor is considered light armor and provides 13 AC + your Dexterity Modifier.
You gain Resistance to Acid, Poison, Piercing, Slashing and Bludgeoning damage and Vulnerability to Thunder and Psychic damage.
You gain Advantage to stealth checks: The mimic is capable ofblending into its surroundings when commanded to take an appropriately stealthy form.
You gain Advantage on Dexterity saving throws: The mimic tries to protect itself by protecting you from any unexpected dangers.
If the wearer dies, the mimic sacrifices itself to return the wearer to 1HP.
The armor can do the following actions:

entries.name: Acid Splash
entries: As an action a target must make a DC13 Dexterity Saving Throw or take {@damage 1d6} Acid Damage.

entries.name: Shapeshift
entries: As an action Mimic can be commanded to consume {@dice 1d6} of the wearer's HP to reset the shape of the armor.

entries.name: Grapple
entries: As a bonus action Mimic can be commanded to stretch out its pseudopod limbs to attempt to grapple a target creature (DC13 Strength Save). You gain advantage on hitting the {@condition grappled} creature.

item.name: Drachenstahl
entries: This charred obsidian blade is crafted from a fragment of the legendary flaming sword of the Fire Giant Surtur.
The bronze handle of this blade is shaped in the form of a roaring dragon breathing fire.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon
The blade grants the wielder resistance to fire damage and advantage on all saving throws against spells and other magical effects
Each successful attack gathers one charge, lighting up one of the 8 empty rubies set into the handle.
With each successful attack, one or more gathered ruby charges can be spent to deal an additional {@damage 1d6} Fire Damage per charge.
As a reaction, the sword can also absorb any oncoming Fire Damage upto {@dice 1d6} x number of empty rubies.
Wielder can spend 3 charges to cast {@spell Burning Hands}
Wielder can spend 8 charges to cast {@spell Fireball}
Each day at dawn, {@dice 1d6 + 2} gathered charges fade away.

item.name: Solsverte
entries: This sword is said to have once belonged to the God
Freyr and was associated with summer, sunshine and fair weather.
This item appears to be a plain longsword hilt.
However, when grasping the hilt, you can cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or make the blade disappear.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
Each attack deals {@damage 1d10} Radiant Damage (instead of slashing damage). When you hit an undead with it, that target takes an extra {@damage 2d8} radiant damage.
A Proficiency with longswords allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

entries.name: Sunrise
entries: You can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or make the blade disappear

entries.name: Special Powers
entries: The Solsverte has 8 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it (Save DC 18):
Solsverte regains {@dice 1d4 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the Solsverte disappears forever.

item.name: Fjelljeger
entries: This beautifully crafted yew bow is said to have been crafted by the mountain goddess Skadi, for the purpose of hunting monstrous wild animals. Wrapped in rare animal furs, this bow is covered with dozens of tiny icicles that never melt.
As revenge against Loki for causing the death of her father Thiazi, Skadi placed a terrifying serpent that constantly drips venom onto the bound Loki.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
A Proficiency with longbows allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.
Each attack deals {@damage 1d8} Piercing Damage and {@damage 2d6} Cold Damage.
The wielder of this longbow is immune to all cold damage and cold weather effects.
When attuned to this artifact, the wielder is immune to fear and charm effects.

entries.name: Loki's Prison
entries: When the wielder hits with an attack, they can declare a Venom {@action Attack}. The target must make a

DC18 constitution save. Upon failure, they are considered {@condition poisoned}, taking an additional {@damage 8d8} poison damage. Upon success, they take half as much poison damage. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. The wielder needs to finish a short or long rest before using this ability again.

entries.name: Special Powers
entries: The Fjelljeger has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it (Save DC 18):
Fjelljeger regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the Fjelljeger melts away into water, disappearing forever.
